question: I never was much for the holidays. stares at the pictures for a moment, wistful. Nick snores, turns over. Rudy climbs atop his bunk again, with the pen this time. And crosses December 18th off the calendar.
answer: What's the first thing, man? What's the first thing you're gonna do?

question: Haven't thought about it.
answer: Hell you haven't.

question: Get to thinking about it, it won't happen.
answer: We walk outta here, we hit that road, what's the first thing you're gonna do.

question: Ain't there yet.
answer: Three days, man.

question: Not yet.
answer: Fuckin' Christmas, man. Fuckin, Christmas on the outs.

question: Hot chocolate.
answer: What?

question: Get a hot mug of chocolate. First thing I'm gonna do.
answer: And a slice of pecan pie, right?

question: And some pecan pie.
answer: She's gonna be out there, man. Right there. Right there waiting.

question: Yeah.
answer: Gonna walk out of this shitstorm and right into her arms.

question: Yeah.
answer: Got us a motel out Highway 5, bringing her own damn sheets, you read that part? Silk damn sheets. Lock ourselves in the whole week, drinking wine, taking baths, man, see if they got those room service steaks... anything I want to do. Remember when she wrote that? Anything I want...

question: Yeah. Fuckin' Christmas. All those pictures she's sent... y'know... you sure they're all of her, Nick? You hear sometimes they don't send their real pictures. Could be her cousin or something.
answer: Why you gotta say a thing like that.

question: I'm just saying.
answer: Why you gotta. We were gonna give you a ride someplace, man. Now I just don't know.

question: I'm just talking.
answer: Fuck your hot chocolate, Rudy. I'm gonna marry this girl. Hey, hey, listen here. "I've made my list and I've checked it twice, and as long as you're naughty, it's gonna be nice. These cold winter weeks have been killing me, Nick, as I lie here alone. It's not enough to have your warmth in my heart anymore; I need your warmth next to me. Work at Penney's has been busy because it's Christmas and that's when we do almost half of our business for the whole year -- ", okay, whatever, whatever -- " -- my manager's still mad at me for asking for the whole week off," whatever, whatever -- Here we go. "And all that gets me through the day is to close my eyes and imagine holding you, and kissing you, and touching you, and tasting you everywhere because I know at that moment, I'll feel I've found the reason for my whole entire life."

question: For twenty-five, she sounds pretty mature.
answer: Yeah. You grow up in Detroit, you get matured real quick. Sure as hell don't make me miss Millie Bobek. Guess I owe Millie, though. If I hadn't been rollin, her, I woulda never ended up here. And I woulda never met Ashley. That's the world for ya.

question: What if she sees you, man, sees what you look like... and it's not there. You just don't do it for her.
answer: Me and her got a connection. Read this part. Read the part about stuffing her stocking.

question: She's using a new perfume.
answer: No, I think that's just oranges. She writes here she's eating oranges.

question: Oh.
answer: Shoulda written to that magazine, Rudy. I'm gonna walk outta here, walk right into a relationship. Not some one-nighter, man... a relationship. You? You're gonna walk outta here with bus fare. Searching for the drunkest skirt in the room.

question: Mornin', gorgeous. More egg nog?
answer: Shoulda written, Rudy... Shoulda got yourself a girl.

question: All I want... is to make it to Sidnaw, and sit down for Christmas dinner. Watch some ball with my old man, sleep in my old bed, and have leftovers for bout six months.
answer: Thought you hated Sidnaw.

question: Just taste that Christmas turkey.
answer: Thought you hate your old man.

question: Five years, Nicky. Five years. I just want to go home.
answer: Well, man. Me and Ashley. We'll be thinking about you.

question: Shit. Alamo's back.
answer: Don't look like he missed the sunlight.

question: Pinscher told me Alamo thinks I'm the one ratted on him beating up Cree. Since I was there, I saw it, he thinks I got him sent to solitary.
answer: Aw, Rudy.

question: Count me outta mealtime -- I'm not hungry, I'm gonna --
answer: What the fuck is this? What's this shit in it? Just so you know, this man and I are outta here in two days. So while we're inhaling London broil and lobster bisque, you're gonna still be standing here smelling up the mystery creamfuck. Who's in prison now?

question: It wasn't me, Alamo --
answer: Two days. So maybe after our week beneath the sheets, we'll head down to Motor City for New Year's. She says her roommate's skipping town for a few days, have the place to ourselves. Remember how her brother's a truck driver down there? I'm thinking he might be able to help get me some work.

question: What, working security?
answer: No, I'm through with that shit. Ashley's right. Gotta start doing something I got a stake in. Get a business going.

question: I don't know, I've seen the business world.
answer: Hotwiring cars, Rudy, does not qualify as a small business. Chop shop consultant; doesn't work on a resume. Ashley's talking about maybe we can start something up together... Whatsa matter, Zook?

question: The hell you doing, Zookerman?
answer: Just a roach, Zook.

question: Monsters in the gelatin...
answer: It's a roach, guy --

question: There are monsters... ...in the gelatin...
answer: Oh, man --

question: THERE ARE MONSTERS IN THE GELATIN!
answer: Fuckin, Zookerman --

question: THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN! THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN! THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!
answer: Rudy, don't move --

question: Rudy, don't move --
answer: Two days, we got two days! Don't do nothing. Don't touch nothing --

question: Don't move, Rudy!
answer: Standing right here, man!

question: Ate the jello, jello was fine! RUDY, LOOK OUT!
answer: NICK! GUARD! GUARD!

question: Alamo...
answer: GUARD!!!

question: Jesus, Rudy --
answer: Take it, man! You're all right! Hold it in! GUARD!

question: Oh, fuck, Rudy... oh Jesus...
answer: GUARD!!!

question: Ash... Ashley...
answer: No, man! No, no, no!

question: Tell her... I'll be there ...
answer: You're GONNA be there! We're getting outta here! TAKE IT!

question: Tell Ashley... I...
answer: YOU TELL HER!

question: ...be with her...
answer: NO!!!

question: ...for Christmas...
answer: NICK!!! NICK!!! The man had two days... turns back, starts toward his bunk. And stops. His eyes on Nick's empty bed. And the wall behind. takes a seat on Nick's bed. There's a shoebox at the foot of it.

question: Rudy, man, here we go, here, what she wrote here
answer: He was burning for you too... drops his head, looks away. Climbs onto the shuttle bus. Don't do it, Rudy... Don't do it ... You Ashley? I'm Nick. I like your coat. This -- this is just something they gave me at the door. Wasn't snowing when we signed up, y'know? How's your coffee?

question: He was burning for you too... drops his head, looks away. Climbs onto the shuttle bus. Don't do it, Rudy... Don't do it ... You Ashley? I'm Nick. I like your coat. This -- this is just something they gave me at the door. Wasn't snowing when we signed up, y'know? How's your coffee?
answer: Good.

question: Gotta be ten degrees out there.
answer: Radio said negative five.

question: Negative five?
answer: Yeah.

question: I don't think it's negative five.
answer: Radio said.

question: Wind chill. That's probably what they meant. I was scared. Scared you were gonna take one look at me and change your mind. Scared I was walking into heartache. All those words... you put a picture in your mind of where they come from and when you see where maybe it's not the same as your picture.
answer: I figured you walked outta there and saw me and walked right the other way --

question: No, no --
answer: Saw my outfit or something, my coat --

question: No, hey, I like your coat --
answer: Saw me --

question: Ashley, no. That was me, that's what I was scared of. I mean, be serious... I ain't exactly looking like Mr. Universe here.
answer: You are to me. Thought you wrote you had a mustache.

question: I can get another one going. Y'know, hey, whatever you want me to --
answer: No, no, no. Be like you want to be.

question: Do that again.
answer: What.

question: Smile.
answer: No --

question: One more. Smile. One more.
answer: No, c'mon --

question: I've been dreaming about that smile, Ashley Mercer. For a long time.
answer: You're better than the picture in my mind, Nick... You're real.

question: Tell me something. This the first time you've ever done this?
answer: Go to hell, Nick Mason, what's that supposed to mean --

question: No, not that, no... I mean this, the whole thing. Start writing to a guy, guy in the bricks. Get a boyfriend like this. Tell me the truth.
answer: Well. You're not the first guy I wrote to. But you're the only one I kept writing to.

question: Yeah. Me too. Why? I mean I know why for me, why I paid for the ad. But you... why start writing to some guy -- some con -- you don't even know?
answer: I told you, Nick. Remember?

question: Tell me again.
answer: All the guys I've ever been with... they never want to know me. Who I am on the inside. They just want to qet inside. When they do, they think that means they know who I am. That I trust them. That they know me. That there's nothing left to learn. A guy like you, Nick -- six months before you can even touch my face. I figure a guy in that kind of bind, he's gonna hafta work to get to know me some other way.

question: Had some bad relationships, didn't you.
answer: Not bad. Just regular. You wrote me wonderful things, Nick. Personal things.

question: Well, wasn't all me, y'know.
answer: Yes it was all you --

question: Guy I was in with... he helped sometimes... some of the romantic stuff, actually... you'd like him --
answer: I'm talking about the heart, Nick. I'm not talking about the words.

question: Y'know, some of the heart mighta been his too...
answer: Then he shoulda signed his name. And he'd be here right now.

question: Where the hell are you going?
answer: Provisions! We are not leaving that motel room again till after New Year's THIS MAN... has not had a cookie in two goddamn years! Get him two of everything!

question: Ashley, Jesus --
answer: Can't survive on our bodies alone, Nick. Hurry up!

question: Ash... didn't you write me that you don't eat chocolate?
answer: Yeah, well you wrote me you were six- foot-four, baby. So don't talk to me about little white lies. You need a COAT!

question: Ash, you've gotten me enough --
answer: No boyfriend of mine is going to walk around in negative-five degree wind chill without a goddamn good- looking coat!

question: Baby, c'mon, all this stuff... I haven't gotten you anything --
answer: You got out, Nick. You're here. You're my Christmas.

question: It's two hundred dollars, Ash --
answer: You forget where I work?

question: Beauty and fragrances.
answer: Fifty percent off, motherfucker. Ho ho ho.

question: Just for the holidays, Nick. Then we'll tell her. We'll let her... have her holidays...
answer: Toys for adults. Where are your toys for adults? C'mon. How old are you, sixteen? C'mon. I got fifty dollars to spend in your store, Jesus of Nazareth. Can you help me or not? Thank you. You know what I was thinking, after our holiday hideaway? Instead of going back to Detroit, maybe we could go gambling. Y'know? Drive up to that Indian place you worked at. Wouldn't that be fun? I haven't gone gambling in forever!

question: Well, I don't know about that --
answer: Blackjack, Nick, blackjack I am good at. I mean, they'd give us some free games or something, wouldn't they? Since you worked there?

question: Security, Ash, I just worked security. They wouldn't be rolling out the red carpet --
answer: And the slots, slots I'm good at too. Wouldn't that be fun?

question: We'll have more fun in Detroit.
answer: We could live it up and --

question: Ashley. We're not going anywhere I used to work.
answer: I just... I thought you'd have friends there...

question: Hey. I been in prison for two years, Ash. Believe me. Those guys wouldn't want to see me.
answer: Well, they don't know what the hell they're missing. Baby, I'm gonna go tell 'em not to disturb us for the rest of the year. I get back in that room, you better be wearing nothing but a candy cane.

question: I'll see what I can do.
answer: No, lover. I'll see what you can do.

question: Watch out, baby! I'm bringing in the fucking tree!
answer: ASHLEY!

question: I'm telling you, we got the best one in the store... I don't know why people want their houses smelling like the stupid woods...
answer: NO!

question: NICK!
answer: Hope her taste in men's better than her taste in Christmas. Hey, sis. Happy holidays. Jumpy, don't hurt her, now. So. This is the guy you been waiting for. Man of your dreams.

question: Gabriel -- !
answer: Must have a way with stationery.

question: Gabriel, what are you doing! GABRIEL!!!
answer: You better be here to be good to her, loverboy. 'Cause she's been good to you.

question: Gabriel, let him go --
answer: Read a lot about you, Nick.

question: What are you doing here?!
answer: Read you're a man of some knowledge.

question: Gabriel!
answer: A man of some travels.

question: Who are you now.
answer: You got the wrong guy! She thinks I'm Nick, I'm not!

question: Put him in the truck.
answer: I was in the joint with him! I knew about him and her, okay!? I took his place!

question: You what...
answer: I got out, Nick didn't! I pretended I was him! I knew about her letters! Jesus Christ, whatever you want from him -- I'm not Nick! I -- I just wanted to be --

question: You're not Nick Mason...
answer: I shared his cell!

question: But you were saying you were...
answer: Yes!

question: So you could get with my sister.
answer: Yes!

question: So you could get down her chimney.
answer: Yes!

question: And you think telling me that's gonna help your cause. Is this him!?
answer: Don't hurt him...

question: Is this the fucker you been writing all year!?
answer: Please, Gabriel, don't...

question: IS THIS NICK MASON!!??
answer: YES!!!

question: Well, he's gonna have to learn to give you some respect.
answer: Hey. They got a shitload of cookies.

question: Take 'em.
answer: How 'bout the tree? You want the tree?

question: Shh, Nick, shh. They won't hurt you now. You're okay... I won't let 'em, Nick. They won't hurt you anymore.
answer: Your brother... ...the truck driver...

question: He's not a bad person, Nick... he's not... You're not gonna hurt him anymore! Since Janey moved in... Gabriel... he's come over more and more. To the apartment. Janey's the divorced one, 'member, with the tit job --
answer: What the fuck is going on.

question: He read the letters, Nick. Some day I wasn't there. He went through my room. He found your letters.
answer: What's going ON!!!

question: He knows you worked in that casino.
answer: You motherfucker.

question: Nick, no --
answer: You sold him out.

question: Nick --
answer: When'd you decide to do it, Ash? After which of his letters, huh? The fortieth? The fiftieth? The first?!

question: Nick, what are you --
answer: I'M NOT NICK! You thought you'd fuck him over?! Well he's fucked you! I've never worked at some casino! I can't help you! Because he's not me!

question: Nick, I love you --
answer: JESUS CHRIST!

question: I'M NOT NICK! Get the hell off of me!
answer: Nick, it won't work. It won't work! He'll kill you.

question: You're not hearing me here --
answer: My brother's killed people, I know he has. Truckers. If you talk him into thinking you're not you, you'll only get yourself dead.

question: He didn't "find" Nick's letters, did he.
answer: Nick, please, it's me --

question: You told him about Nick's letters.
answer: No, Nick, no --

question: You're in on this.
answer: I love you!

question: Y'know, in a way, I'm glad it's me. 'Cause you woulda broken his heart. Your pen palls dead, lady.
answer: If you say that, if you keep saying that, they will kill you. If they think you're not you, they will kill you. Don't you see? I know what you're doing, but it won't work!

question: Nick died for me....
answer: I won't let him hurt you! He just wants what you know!

question: ...maybe I die for Nick...
answer: Just tell him what you know, Nick! That's all they want! And we'll get out of this! He found them... I swear, Nick... ...he found them...

question: Bury this guy.
answer: Gabriel, you promised!

question: I promised that when he helped us, we'd be gone! When he helped us! Loverboy don't want to play!
answer: You promised me!

question: And you promised me you'd get your sweetheart to help! He'd rather die than be with you, he'd make a fucked-up boyfriend anyway. Bury him all over the place.
answer: NO!

question: Hey. She says she loves you, Nick.
answer: She says a lot of things.

question: She's getting you to help us... 'cause she knows if you don't, you're dead. You just tell us what we need to know, you two live happily ever after. My sister loves you, motherfucker, and I ain't gonna have you break her heart.
answer: Wish I had a brother like you.

question: A girl says she loves you, you say something.
answer: I had better sex in prison.

question: The man who wrote those letters loved Ashley, boys. He lived for her love. Let's see him live for love. Where's she work?
answer: What?

question: Wrote you a hundred letters, didn't she? Where's she work?
answer: J.C. Penney. Beauty and fragrances.

question: What's her middle name?
answer: Samantha.

question: What'd they call her in high school?
answer: Bam Bam.

question: What'd they call her in college?
answer: What college.

question: Canada.
answer: Be more specific.

question: A station wagon in Canada.
answer: What's her greatest fear?

question: Her brother.
answer: Wrong, Nick. It's drowning.

question: No. It's her brother.
answer: That's love. Let's get back on the road. It's time to start talking, Nick. Time to start telling tales --

question: We're talking, aren't we? How much money's in that casino? Day-to-day.
answer: I don't know.

question: The hell you don't.
answer: Five million?

question: You wrote Ash that letter, you told her that story 'bout working Christmas Eve, bout how they'd send half the security guys home, nobody comin, in that night. And the rest of you got shit-faced drinking hot buttered rum. That a true story now?
answer: Christmas... Eve...

question: You know where the guards are. You know how to get in and out. You know where the money is. We're taking down that casino, convict. You're the guy gonna tell us how.
answer: Hey, it's... been two years --

question: We got faith in you, Nick Mason. You're our inside man.
answer: ...goddamn it, Rudy... goddamn it... goddamn girl, goddamn Nick... you're so smart, so fucking smart... Where's your Christmas dinner now...

question: Who the hell made this map.
answer: What?

question: I said, who the hell made the map?
answer: I did.

question: This isn't the Tomahawk.
answer: What the fuck are you talking about.

question: They recognize him, they'll remember him after the job goes down.
answer: They won't recognize me.

question: Why not.
answer: Trust me. They won't recognize me.

question: We'll trust you when we're rich. Why not.
answer: 'Cause you're gonna get me a disguise. I give you the wrong information, you're gonna shoot me. Well, I don't know your damn map. So you can either find a way to get me in there... or you can shoot me right now.

question: Bring back some memories, Nick?
answer: More than you know. What the hell is this? What happened to working together?

question: Rather be back in the Mountain?
answer: Might as well be.

question: Don't have Weather Channel in the Mountain, Nick. Sleep good, loverboy. Tomorrow you got singing for your supper to do.
answer: Get your own room.

question: Get your own room.
answer: He said he wanted to talk to you. When he found the letters... he said "when your boyfriend gets out, I wanna talk to him." I thought he meant back in Detroit. I thought he meant --

question: But you knew why. Knew why, didn't ya.
answer: I thought we'd have a few more days.

question: For what? You to talk me into "helping"? What, he promise you a share of the winnings?
answer: No!

question: Well, shit, Judas, you shoulda at least gotten that --
answer: Nick! He wants to know how to rob it, and he'll leave you alone! That's all he wants! I hate him, Nick... you know how...

question: So get him outta your life. Get out of Michigan. They got perfume counters in Chicago, don't they?
answer: Not without you.

question: Since when do some trucker pals start thinking big, anyway?
answer: They run routes mostly east, retail stuff, warehouses. But Gabriel knows some guys in New York, Miami, guys he helps get guns to Detroit. Hides 'em with his regular loads.

question: He working for them on this one?
answer: No. He wants to be working for himself someday.

question: And I'm his ticket. What's the last place they took down?
answer: What?

question: Gabriel and his guys. What's the last place they robbed?
answer: I don't think they've ever robbed anything before. I think they've just driven guns.

question: They've never done a robbery?
answer: They're truck drivers.

question: Then they do need me, don't they. They really need me...
answer: We're gonna get out of here, Nick. We're gonna get out of this...

question: We? What "we"... Get your own room, Ashley.
answer: Nick...

question: Get your own room.
answer: If I'd told you what he wanted, you'd have been gone. You'd have gotten on that bus and stayed on it. And if that's selfish, I am. If that's lying, I'm a liar. But I been dealing with fucked-up brother and his fucked-up friends for a long time, and I was stronger than him then and I'm stronger than him now. 'Cause he showed up for money. I showed up for love. And if you're so ready to make me your enemy... then what did you show up for, Nick. What did you really want... with me...

question: Take a look what Pug's bought for ya.
answer: A cowboy. You're going to send me into an Indian casino disguised as a cowboy. Have you thought this entirely through?

question: Put it on. You're a country-western singer up from Nashville for the the holidays. Visiting your Grandma on the lake, driving into the Tomahawk for some scotch and slots. You only play the slots, you got that? Don't want no dealer friend of yours recognizing you, you sidle up to shoot some craps.
answer: What kind of half-ass cowboy plays the slots?

question: You do.
answer: At least gimme video poker.

question: Shut the fuck up. You play what your girlfriend plays. Ashley's going in with you. You talk to her, otherwise you don't talk to nobody. You walk the room as many times as you want, but the second you come out, I want to know the run of the place.
answer: Do I get a country-western name?

question: You get recognized, convict, You get a country-western funeral.
answer: Y'know what, guys? I woke up this morning, I got a really lucky feeling going on. I mean it, I'm feeling that good. I wouldn't be surprised if I walk in there, pull a handle and hit jackpot. Hell, we wouldn't even have to --

question: You got one hour.
answer: I'm gonna need some money. Ten dollars? What do I do with ten dollars?

question: Don't tip.
answer: Monster. If we're working together here, we gotta be working together. I can't walk in there looking like the Lone Fucking Ranger with ten bucks to throw down. You don't want me getting noticed, right? Not getting noticed costs a guy at least a couple hundred.

question: Don't. Lose.
answer: You ready to gamble, darlin'? Y'all take care of my guitar.

question: There's an S-word I'd really like to throw in the discussion here, guys, cause it's a big part of what's going on. Big element, 'kay? S-word. It's a serious issue, serious factor, so I'm just gonna get it out there, throw it an out there, so we can know it, we can talk about it, we can get things done... Snow. Are you with me, guys? Snow. Big time, fucking, grade-A, God- quality, S-N-O-W-snow. There's no snow in Vegas, 'kay? They don't know it, they don't want it, they got laws against the stuff. They got Egypt down there, right, they got Monte Carlo, Hawaii, they got ancient Rome, but where's the Winter Castle, right? Where's the Swiss miss Chalet? Where's the Big Fucking Igloo?
answer: We understand you, Mr. Bangs.

question: Capades? They don't do it. Mittens? Outlawed. Why?
answer: We're aware of your position.

question: Because down there this is money. Up here this is heat. You wanted Vegas quality, I brought it to you. You wanted Vegas press, I gave it to you. But guys, please, guys... I can't get you Vegas profits... till one of ya does some spirit dance and does something about this snow. The Paiutes, they cook their books. Seventeen? I'm bringing in this great showroom act next week; these three Russian girls, they look like Meryl Streep, they can juggle anything.
answer: Mr. Bangs.

question: Guys. We're doing it right, here. $5.99 prime rib? Nobody does that in Michigan. Nobody.
answer: The tribe is concerned that many of your... new ideas are not resulting in any new venues.

question: I'm putting liquor in the drinks, I'm giving 10-times odds on craps, I got the girls showing sixteen-percent more skin! Show me another buffet's gonna offer you Coke and Pepsi! Whaddya want me to do?!
answer: We want to see our casino making money again, Mr. Bangs. Making money for our community. We want you doing the job... that we brought you here to do.

question: So does it look a lot different?
answer: Here and there. Restaurant, uh, that's the main expansion. Tables've been moved around; the big man's office, I dunno, might be upstairs now.

question: That guy knows you?
answer: Yeah, uh. Mike. That's Mike. You start spending your brother's money. I'm gonna take a circuit around the joint, check for any new ins and outs. I'll snag us some drinks.

question: Be careful, Nick...
answer: Couple rum and Cokes, please.

question: Couple rum and Cokes, please.
answer: Gimme a goddamn bottle of anything. I can't go back to Vegas, Bear. They'll fuckin' kill me, 'kay? I can't go back... They want gold-paved roads is what they want. Talking 'bout the fuckin' Paiutes. Fuckin' Paiutes are on the interstate. Nothing I can do about that, man, I didn't pick the spot for your reservation. Yeah, yeah, whatever. Hey. Hey, cowboy. Jack Bangs, I run the place. Nice to have you in the Tomahawk. Tell me something... ...does upstate Michigan need another roadside casino or does upstate Michigan need an international gaming destination?

question: Roadside casino?
answer: Well, so how'd you hear about this place, then. Word-of-mouth? Mass mailings? Cable TV?

question: Prison.
answer: Prison?! I can't go back to Vegas, Bear... I can't... Aw fuck.

question: He didn't recognize me. Back off, willya? He didn't recognize me.
answer: Hey Nick! We're up fifty cents!

question: Heyyyy!
answer: Nick, what happened --

question: Thanks, sister. How are ya.
answer: Fuckin' freezing.

question: Hell yeah. You work here long?
answer: Five years. Since it opened.

question: How long ago was your makeover?
answer: My what?!

question: No, the place. The remodeling. moving everything around.
answer: The Tomahawk's looked the same since I started, mister. Only the losers change.

question: A for effort, Nick, honestly, A for effort and an honorary degree. I'm surprised you never escaped from the Mountain.
answer: ...never... tried...

question: Nick, here's what we're gonna do. In the spirit of the season, I'm going to give you a chance. I understand you're unhappy. Right outta the lockup, here against your will, it's the holidays and there's reruns on We're each going to get one of these. Whichever one of us hits closer to the bullseye... gets what he wants. You land closer, you get Ashley. And you guys get to go free. I land closer... and we start getting your help. May the best sportsman win. Damn. Got something to say to me, Nick?
answer: ...ttt..tt... two out of three?

question: What'd you tell that casino manager?
answer: Nnn... nothing...

question: You were talking to him! What'd you tell him!?
answer: Nothing... I promise-nothing...

question: MAYBE SOMETHING ABOUT A ROBBERY?
answer: NO! He thought I was some gambler... he didn't know me... he didn't recognize me!

question: I been driving rigs a long time, Nick. Four, five million miles of road. Worked for people who wouldn't keep me on less I was driving fifteen hours a day. Tell 'em I needed sleep, I needed rest, shit, they'll hire someone else... ...Dispatcher's screaming for me to haul ass, he's got a load on the runback for me. Shipper's making me wait for the pickup, receiver's bitching 'bout the count... ...Got the cops at the bottom of every mountain, got the DOT at the top. And every day, every day, I see all those faces in their little airbag Hot Wheels, moms and pops and jam- faced kiddies, giving me that look to go to hell and get off their happy goddamn highway. Hey. They don't gotta get two thousand miles by sundown, or the gang don't eat come sunrise. It's time for me... to be working for me. I want mine, Nick. And I need you. Did you tell your manager there's gonna be a robbery?
answer: No, Gabriel... no... ...he... he asked me... how I'd heard about his place... he didn't know it was me... Man, Monster... just... just don't start trying to hit me...

question: Nick, oh my God, what'd he do to you? What'd he do?
answer: He had some points to make...

question: Jesus Christ, stay here, don't move, stay right here --
answer: All I wanted... was to make it home... for a little of Dad's turkey, and Mom's stuffing... Aunt Lisbeth's acorn gravy... Aunt Mary's cranberry buns...

question: We'll get there, baby... we'll get there...
answer: ...Haven't had cranberry buns... in five whole years...

question: Shh, now. Rest now. Two years, Nick. You haven't had cranberry buns in two years. You saved my life. You could have run, but you didn't. You saved me.
answer: You saved me.

question: I saved you because I love you, Nick. Why'd you save me?
answer: Guy I was in with... car thief... I used to read your letters to him. I know they were private... I know, but... you spend twenty-four hours a day with somebody, you gotta talk, y'know? You gotta share. Or the room gets even smaller. And sometimes, I'd be reading them, and he'd close his eyes, get a smile on his face... and I'd know somewhere inside he was pretending you were writing to him -- He'd see your face, your pictures on the wall... Some nights I think he fell in love with you, too. You gave a couple guys hope, Ashley. And with hope, there ain't nothing you can't survive.

question: I'm sorry, Nick... I'm so sorry...
answer: Don't say my name...

question: I love you, Nick...
answer: Ash. Don't say it. Don't say my name.

question: I love you...
answer: They'll have guns.

question: What?
answer: You said they've run guns, in their trucks. So they'll have guns. To do this robbery. They'll have serious guns.

question: I don't know...
answer: We'll need one. I'm going to have to be inside that casino. When it happens. I'll need to be part of it. I can't just be drawing some map.

question: Nick, what are you talking about?
answer: We need to find a way to make me part of it.

question: Part of... with them?
answer: If we're helping them with their robbery, we're gonna be doing more than just walking away. Like that's some Christmas bonus. You want him outta your life? You want a real New Year to look forward to? If we're gonna do this... we're gonna do it to get it all.

question: Knew a guy in Joliet, smoked ten packs a day like you. His lungs got so black they couldn't find 'em with an x-ray.
answer: That right? Shit. I used to run rigs for a guy loved your chaw there. Shit rotted out his tongue, had to build him one outta silicon so the poor boy could talk. You ever see a motherfucker with a silicon fucking tongue?

question: Hell. The guy from Joliet, those black-ass lungs were the least of his problems. Got so much smoke in him his lungs couldn't even hold it. Got into his system, man. Into his blood. Coming out his ears, man, coming out his eyes. Guy'd be walking the row, smoke'd be puffing out his skin.
answer: This trucker? Met a girl in a bar one night, she didn't know his situation. He's drunk, she's drunk, they get to mackin' hot and heavy and the woman swallows it. His tongue. Sucks it right down.

question: My guy would walk into a room, set off the goddamn sprinklers.
answer: His lips went next. You ever see some silicon-fucking-lips? Vegetarians...

question: What you gotta worry about first is the guards. Place doesn't look much richer than when I worked there, so let's figure you're gonna have to deal with ten of 'em. There'll be two on the floor, walking the room, that leaves eight up above. Eyes in the sky. They see something up, they're the ones who'll hit the silent alarm and you're fucked.
answer: How do we take them out?

question: You gotta get someone upstairs.
answer: How do we do that?

question: You lock down security, you move behind the cage. You hit the Count Room. There'll be a guy in there but he's got no guns; room's accessed by another code. Cashiers'll know it. They'll have alarms.
answer: What about the Powwow Safe?

question: What?
answer: The Powwow Safe. The secret safe. You said the manager's got a safe in his office where he hides skim money.

question: Oh. Right. Yeah. That's, uh upstairs. Uh. Here. Powwow Safe. So. You're gonna need a man through here, two men at the cage, one to cover the count. You're gonna need a lookout outside, a sweeper through the back, and a gun guarding the front. You need six.
answer: We got five. Putting Ashley outside.

question: You need six. You go in with five, you're either leaving an alarm free or an exit free. Someone hits an alarm, you're fucked. Someone gets to a phone, gets outside, 'cross the street, whatever, you're fucked. You need six. Six is me.
answer: No.

question: I want a map of that security level. Every room, every guard, every thing.
answer: Six men means six guns.

question: No way.
answer: I'm no threat without a gun.

question: No, you're not.
answer: There'll be people in that casino. I can't keep them from leaving if I don't get a gun. I don't need bullets, Monster... but I gotta be a threat.

question: No gun.
answer: Well. What you guys have to plan out, then... is how you're going to get to that cage and that security level before anybody realizes anything's wrong. Running in with ski masks and bullets flying ain't gonna do it.

question: That part, Nick... was planned out the day I read your letters.
answer: What. We all gonna dress up like cowboys?

question: Not cowboys, Nick. Not cowboys. Not on Christmas Eve.
answer: You gotta be kidding me.

question: 'Tis the season, convict. Can't be attracting attention, right?
answer: What, we walking in there and delivering toys?

question: He wants to see your map.
answer: I'm almost done.

question: He says he wants it now.
answer: If he wanted a photographic memory, he shoulda kidnapped one. I'm working on it here.

question: How are we gonna do this, Nick?
answer: You're the getaway girl. The money's gonna get to you eventually. Gonna be my job to be the guy who walks outta there with it. But I can't do that without a gun. Any luck talking to him?

question: Bullets or no bullets, he won't do it.
answer: Is there any way you could get into his truck?

question: No.
answer: We need a gun, Ash. We need a gun... Here's the Picasso. Is he in his room?

question: They all are. Football's on.
answer: Keep 'em there for a little while. We're gonna get you out of Detroit, Ash. Get you out of beauty and fragrances. Remember that. After all this is over, when you know me, when you really know me... remember it was me. Gun, gun, c'mon, boys like you gotta be keeping a gun...

question: ...and he's saying "We're not gonna help him just to walk away. If we're gonna help him... we're gonna get it all... ...he wants to help now, he wants to rob it now we could probably stay right here, he'd go on and rob it by himself --
answer: He wants the money.

question: No, baby. He wants me. He wants... your "sister"...
answer: ...whoever she is.

question: Nick Mason's gonna help us more than we ever dreamed.
answer: All those letters are about to pay off, baby... all those letters...

question: To all those cons...
answer: Searching for a money man...

question: We musta written what, twenty of 'em? And they were before this guy. One, two letters apiece, ten to the racetrack guy in Leavenworth --
answer: -- till he fucked his parole --

question: -- plus the forty to Mason... how many letters is that?
answer: That's a book, baby. That's a book of love. I can't take watching you touch him. I can't take his hands on you.

question: One more day, baby. One more day to Christmas.
answer: I've been doing good, though.

question: Didn't have to hit me so fucking hard. Didn't have to throw me outta the goddamn truck.
answer: Didn't have to send me down a fucking mountain.

question: What, he should see me help you catch him? He's shown us the setup, he's drawn us the map, he's helped us do the plan. He wants a gun, give him a gun. Take the bullets out, whatever, but give him the gun. The more manpower we've got in there, the better. He won't try and make his move till the money's in hand.
answer: He'll be dead when he does. Y'know something, baby? If you were my sister? I'd still want to wake up Christmas morning with you...

question: Merlin ambles the corridor. Approaching Rudy's room.
answer: Rudy flings open the Blazer door, slams the emergency brake down. Forces the gearshift into "Reverse."

question: Merlin reaches Rudy's door. Searches his pockets for the key.
answer: Rudy darts to the front of the Blazer, slipping and sliding on asphalt ice. He drops to his knees, pushing on the front bumper.

question: How are you tonight?
answer: Fuckin' freezing. What can I get ya, Santa?

question: Jack and Coke.
answer: Want that Jack and Coke or Jack and Pepsi?

question: Switch seats with me.
answer: What? No...

question: You're taking my money. Switch seats with me. Switch seats with me if you're not taking my money --
answer: I'm ninety-two years old --

question: Then get yourself another table! You're hitting Santa's cards and you're taking Santa's money!
answer: There is no other table --

question: I told you not to fuck us with that map, Nick. I told you not to, and you did. How am I s'posed to keep my promises now? How's she s'posed to keep hers? He won't tell us where it is. The Powwow Safe.
answer: I don't know... what you're...

question: THE POWWOW SAFE! WHERE IS THE POWWOW SAFE!
answer: What... Powwow...

question: The Powwow Safe where you steal your money! Where you cheat your Indians!
answer: I don't steal any --

question: We KNOW about the Powwow Safe! We KNOW it's in here! We KNOW how you work! Because WE know who's worked for you! Remember a guy named Nick Mason!? A security guard named Nick Mason!?
answer: Nick... Mason... ? ...so where is he?

question: Where is he?! Where is he?!
answer: He's not Nick Mason... Nick Mason... worked for me two years ago. This man... ...he's some cowboy...

question: I saved your life.
answer: You shouldn't have.

question: He did love you, you know. Nick. He did love you.
answer: Who wouldn't.

question: Maybe this is where you wanted him, Ashley. At the bottom of a ravine, dead as ice with a burnt-up heart. Maybe. But it didn't happen. 'Cause what you did for him was make him the happiest held ever been. You showed him hope and taught him mercy. And he died a peaceful man. You wanted to destroy some convict... and all you did was save his soul. Remember that. Love your money and remember that.
answer: Merry Christmas, Rudy.

question: I'm glad it was me.
answer: Merry Christmas.

question: How'd you know my name...
answer: What?

question: Rudy. How'd you know my name?
answer: What are you talking about?

question: You said Merry Christmas, Rudy.
answer: I... you told me your name was Rudy. You told me a million times, back in the truck, telling me you weren't Nick --

question: No --
answer: You were screaming you weren't Nick! And we just didn't fucking believe you!

question: But I never said Rudy.
answer: You said it a million times!

question: I never told you my name.
answer: Ash?

question: How'd you know my name was Rudy.
answer: Ash?

question: Oh, hey. Have you two been properly introduced? Sweetness, this is Rudy Duncan, I did almost a year with him in the Mountain. Read him all your letters, talked about you all the time, made him feel like he really knew you. My friend... wantcha to meet Millie Bobek. 'Member Millie Bobek, dontcha? My girlfriend fore I went in? Worked at that bar in Motor City, where I manslaughtered that guy? Hell. Didn't talk about her much once the Ashley letters started coming, I guess. Millie here used to serve drinks to these gunrunning truckers, real big talkers, talking bout a real score one day. I was in the Mountain, man, what the hell, why not let her get friendly with 'em? Let her tell 'em an idea she had, 'bout writing guys in prison. Getting one who could show 'em a sure thing.
answer: She set them up. All of them.

question: Why not have her pretend to find me? Pretend to write me and reel me in? Tell her new trucker-man she'd pose as some sister of his named Ashley?
answer: And you set me up.

question: Always wanted to rob that casino, Rudy. Way back when I worked there. What better way than to get some guys to rob it for me. Paid the Alamo ten bucks to put the shiv in me. He's a lifer, what does he care. Paid a hospital guard fifty to put out the story I was dead. Once the wound healed up... Got out of the Mountain this morning. And tonight I'm a rich man.
answer: How'd you know I'd do it.

question: Do what?
answer: Walk outta there and tell her I was you.

question: Because every time I read her letters, Rudy... you listened. Keep your gun on him. Five Santas walked into that Tomahawk, Rudy. That's what the witnesses'll say. So we gotta have five Santas not walk out. Gotta have five... This'll burn right away... in the fire... Hell, you never needed to convince Ashley you were me. Just the dumb fucking truckers. I figured I'd talked enough about the Tomahawk in the pen for you to get by --
answer: Talked about the old man's weapons stash, probably forgot I'd remember

question: Hm. Well. They'd have killed you if you weren't me, Rudy. We knew you'd start convincing 'em soon enough. They had the weapons and the willpower. We just gave them their inside man.
answer: You gave them me.

question: I gave them me. Said some nice things about me, Rudy. I appreciate it. But don't worry. I do love her. And she loves me. You had that right all along. Sweetness! Let's light up the tree! Goodbye, Rudy! Nice spending time with you!
answer: LIKE RIDING A BIKE, LIKE RIDING A BIKE, LIKE RIDING A BIIIIIKE! RULE ONE! NEVER PUT A CAR THIEF BEHIND THE WHEEL!
